documents.document: @GregorSwanson I was all set to jump in with the three-count but he was back on his feet almost instantly.
@GregorSwanson He jumped off the sofa towards her and she half-caught him but he deflected off her and landed on his back. He was loving it.

Conversation between @IslaRamsay and 4 y/o nephew:
"Auntie Isla, are you from the olden days?"
"No! I'm 29!"
"So you're from these days?"
Used to hate when Fed won all the time but can't begrudge him that one. Feel for Rafa. Another epic battle in a legendary rivalry. #AusOpen
Yesterday I saw my girlfriend's mum pay homage to WWF wrestler D'lo Brown by executing a near-textbook Sky High on her 4-year old grandson.
That awkward moment when you turn up to the #AusOpen final and you're wearing the same shorts, socks and shoes as eâ€¦ https://t.co/85IbMGNtDR
Desperate times for LL Cool J having to audition on #TheVoice. https://t.co/CrjsFpie1F
Another #T2trainspotting observation. Of the various Hibee cameos, I have to say I was most impressed by @jmcginn7 as Begbie's son.
There we have it. And that's science speaking. You can't argue with science. #baldtruth https://t.co/gQ8uIQMtjU
Meanwhile, in the Morgan household, Piers is watching #GrahamNorton. https://t.co/Vfp6TCtTaC
@neil_snooze Yeah we re-watched the first a few days ago as well. Definitely adds to the sense of nostalgia in T2.
So, to sum up... @T2Trainspotting #DannyBoyle @mcgregor_ewan @robertcarlyle_ @jonnyjlm #EwenBremner https://t.co/bzm0hoRetf
Whole soundtrack was fantastic actually. "Silk" by Wolf Alice is an absolute tune. #T2trainspotting
Loved the nostalgia of it: the bits lifted directly from the books, the opening chords of Born Slippy echoing periodically. #T2trainspotting
Had a smidgeon of fear heading to see #T2trainspotting that it wouldn't live up to the hype. Fear very much alleviated - it's sensational.
"Happy hunting ground". ðŸ˜‚ Sure we've got a similar record at Parkhead. By that logic, Celtic will be quaking in theâ€¦ https://t.co/4qY7RuJbS4
@LiamBain87 Yeah but think of all the kids films you'll get to see in the years to come. Congrats btw! Absolute spit of you. ðŸ˜„
@LiamBain87 1. Collateral Beauty, 2. A Monster Calls, 3. La La Land, 4. Rogue One. For my 140 character reviews, please see previous tweets.
Film five of 2017: #ManchesterByTheSea. Liked it, but it was the sort of sombre slow-burner I doubt I'd sit through again.
Here, anyone else remember that time @piersmorgan got absolutely pied by Ewan McGregor then spent days greetin' and tweeting about it?
@piersmorgan @mcgregor_ewan Run along to Papa Donald. He'll kiss it better for you, "Champ".
He's no C.J. Cregg, that's for sure. https://t.co/8navsLUW3T
@GregorSwanson The innocence of youth. I'd trade her mindset for my own in a heartbeat.
I get some of the ridicule towards Van Basten, but a dislike (or ignorance) of other sports is a lame argument against reform in football.
Perfect excuse to unearth my favourite clip of Patrick Stewart having a laugh and not taking himself too seriously. https://t.co/mvZQDbmQU0
Well this has made my year. https://t.co/wGPQxIbnNK
@mrewanmurray @Follow_Follow_ So you address refereeing standards. Collum's flaws as a ref aren't synonymous with flaws of sin bins.
@sked21 No need for an orange card though. Ten minute sin bin for a yellow card would suffice.
@sked21 The sin bin idea is the only one I'm on board with. Would cut out cynical fouls and players "taking one for the team".
At a time when Hollywood chucks ðŸ’µ at tired, repetitive franchises like Fast & Furious, it's great that #StarWars remains fresh and original.
Loved #RogueOne. Plenty callbacks for the diehard fan without turning it into a Star Wars tribute film. A gripping chapter in its own right.
Second solo lunch in a row. @GregorSwanson @joaqpheonix https://t.co/YTWiEVO51A
No @GregorSwanson or @joaqpheonix at work today. Sitting on my lunch like... https://t.co/UHFP1bggxZ
@GregorSwanson @joaqpheonix @tagropemag Sons of Anarchy meets Some Mothers Do 'Ave 'Em. Brilliant find.
That Andy Carroll goal from yesterday should be worth at least double. Five points doesn't do it justice.â€¦ https://t.co/HNuJ7yjdWx
Maybe a little dated, considering it was published over 20 years ago, but an interesting snapshot in time nonetheless. Worth a read.
Just finished Football Against the Enemy by @KuperSimon. An absorbing study of football's close relationship with politics around the world.
That moment when you find out Channel 4 are bringing back #TheCrystalMaze. https://t.co/FBZa3QW6L0
Is there anything Gosling can't turn his hand to? Serious, comical, musical. Almost as versatile as Barry. #LaLaLand https://t.co/lTtWcrt3VD
More cinema. #LaLaLand: a classy modern-day nod to 50s-era musicals. Reminded me of the Gene Kelly films we watched in Standard Grade music.
@neil_snooze Experience our defence is crying out for and will help youngsters like Souttar immeasurably. Hard to draw negatives from this.
Second cinema trip of 2017: #AMonsterCalls. If this gut-wrenchingly honest portrayal of grief doesn't make you cry, then you're dead inside.
Saw this and thought it might have been because you'd run out of Applewood Smoked Cheddar, @MichaelLiness. Relievedâ€¦ https://t.co/tNogZfe8wO
Gary Barlow pitching #LetItShine to the BBC. https://t.co/2BkxkuMU6Q
That Mika performance on #Pointless was like one of those random Conway Twitty interludes on Family Guy. Very bizarre.
Not paid much attention to Scottish lower league football the past couple of years but this Dundee Utd team is honking. How are they second?
Meanwhile, in Scotland, we have a national team manager who doesn't seem to recognise who our best players are in almost every position.
Over-hyping players and piling this kind of pressure on them at such an early stage in their careers is so quintessâ€¦ https://t.co/P7AAMCzn27
@GregorSwanson I like Will Smith but his ratio of good films to bad ones isn't great. This one tips the balance back in his favour slightly.
@GregorSwanson I'd say so. It's a very emotional film but some of the lines were a bit cheesy. Smith's very good in it though, to be fair.
First cinema trip of 2017: #CollateralBeauty. On the Will Smith scale, it was neither "After Earth bad", nor "Seven Pounds good". 6.5/10.
2017 can shove its healthy diets and detox plans. I discovered this the other day and it's pretty much made life inâ€¦ https://t.co/RQh88GnVhN
I take it this means all the bloaters who retire to Benidorm will be given Spanish lessons before they go? https://t.co/rFqgxrK3mj
Putting to one side the fact he'd be a good acquisition, I mainly want this to happen for the delicious seethe it'lâ€¦ https://t.co/ITFvur0vfm
@GregorSwanson We saw it the other week and enjoyed it. Hanks is a safe pair of hands. 7/10.
Must be rough being a member of the Mitchell clan. #Eastenders
I feel for the next generation. In 2016 we've mourned some absolute icons. In 50 years they'll be left to mourn a few Kardashians and Dappy.
The only thing worse than Clarkson and Hammond are the knuckle-draggers in the studio audience applauding their chronic brand of "banter".
If nothing else, this Richard Hammond episode offers a perfect excuse to watch my favourite 15 mins of standup ever. https://t.co/NfH1eDXSdc
@GregorSwanson My guess is he'll rate Scott Bain's performance quite highly.
@GregorSwanson Defence aside, they seemingly played some of the best stuff they've played in ages. Confident he'll get results soon enough.
@GregorSwanson I know you're just fishing, but that should really read "Hearts defence ðŸ™ˆ".
Never a penalty. No contact from Samson. Rooney cons the ref by clipping his own leg. But Jamie Walker's the only diver in this league, eh?
In fact, the complete lack of peanut butter representation across all the big Xmas sweet tubs, in this day and age, is an injustice IMHO.
Nestle would do well to bin either the toffee penny or toffee finger from Quality Street and get some peanut butter in there.
Hope Courtney's interview with Claude involves him being slapped about then dangled out the window by his stupid pink tie. #TheApprentice
Good news @IslaRamsay! https://t.co/Db1DeEalUo
@michaelsadler87 Thought you were allergic?
@neil_snooze His rage was absolutely delicious. I love how upset Cathro is making people without having said anything inflammatory himself.
@lesleym1987 I've actually enjoyed this year more than last year. That might have more to do with the sweepstake we've had at work though.
Probably the worst final five #TheApprentice has ever coughed up.
Miss you bbz. @jdob78 #TheApprentice https://t.co/3RhfHlGP8C
@neil_snooze Disagree entirely re the haircut. I say grow it longer! The old boys network with their short back and sides will be hating it.
@RFBorthwick Never understood the Biffy Clyro hype. Embarrassingly over-rated. Far better Scottish bands out there, Admiral Fallow for one.
@GregorSwanson Amazing! A Swanson family conference about food. You must've been in your element. ðŸ˜‚
Loved a UCI trip as a kid. Also have fond memories of the Odeon, sneaking into films I was too young for. #thuglife https://t.co/qIgSfnBabg
@GregorSwanson Lies. Nobody denied it. We simply pointed out that it didn't make a difference, she's still hot and you have high standards.
@sforrest86 Scottish football is run by a private members club with no transparency. Unless that changes, Pot 6 obscurity beckons.
@sforrest86 To be honest, I've become so apathetic about the national team that yesterday's news barely registered with me. I'm past caring.
@sforrest86 Exactly. I could "do my best" if put in charge of the national team. Doesn't make me the ideal candidate for the job though.
Taking days off work to wait for IKEA deliveries to arrive. https://t.co/LQrHi5ShSW
@RFBorthwick I did #solocinema earlier today for the first time. Massively underrated. Doesn't deserve the social stigma.
Eagle Royal Rumble kicking off on #planetearth2.

Perfect song choice by @OC on @absoluteradio this morning. "Mad World" by Tears for Fears. #ElectionNight
Only went to see #AStreetCatNamedBob because we missed The Accountant. Glad we did in the end. A nice uplifting film for a Sunday afternoon.
@neil_snooze He's a talented but infuriating player to watch. Has a chronic fear of shooting.
